posts.title: My Research
posts.text: Xiangqi KongIntroduction Ph.D. Student (Sept. 2017 - Present)Department of Electrical, Computer and Biomedical EngineeringUniversity of Rhode Island Email: xqkong{AT}uri.edu Phone: (401)-212-3493 Reserach Interests: Applications: Virtual/Mixed Reality, Communication Networks Theory: Stochastic Processes, Optimization Brief BiographyXiangqi Kong received his B.S. degree in Network Engineering in 2017, from Dalian University of Technology. Currently he is a Ph.D. student in Department of Electrical, Computer and Biomedical Engineering of University of Rhode Island advised by Prof. Bin Li. Xiangqiâ€™s main research interest in Wireless Networks, Virtual/Augmented Reality, Edge Computing, and Big Data Processing. Awards NSF/ACM Student Travel Grant, ACM MobiHoc, 2018 Charles Pagella Graduate Fellowship Award, University of Rhode Island, USA, 09/2017 - 05/2018 Best Poster Award, ACM MobiHoc 2018 Publications Bin Li, Xiangqi Kong, Lei Wang, Poster: Optimal Load-Balancing for High-Density Wireless Networks with Flow-Level Dynamics, In ACM International Symposium on Mobile Ad Hoc Networking and Computing (MobiHoc), Los Angeles, California, June 2018 (poster paper). [Technical Report] [Best Poster Award] Minghui Weng, Xiangqi Kong, Lianfen Huang, Bin Li, Demo: A Low-Cost Wireless System Implementation for Interactive and Immersive Teaching, In ACM International Symposium on Mobile Ad Hoc Networking and Computing (MobiHoc), Los Angeles, California, June 2018 (demo paper).
